flowerslist.info: Large double. Good grower, heavy bloomer. Early to mid-season, acid loving plants. Plant in moist well drained soil with pH of 4.0-5.5.
flowerslist.name: Azalea

flowerslist.info: Beautiful large royal purple flowers adorn attractive satiny green leaves that turn orange or red in cold weather
flowerslist.name: Tibouchina Semidecandra

flowerslist.info: Blooms in summer, 20-35 inches high. Fertilize regularly for best results. Full sun, drought tolerant.
flowerslist.name: Hibiscus

flowerslist.info: They do not thrive indoors, where the light is too dim, and humidity too low, for them to grow properly.
flowerslist.name: Bonsai Tree

flowerslist.info: Blooms continuously from early spring to first frost. Full sun or part shade, moist well-drained soil.
flowerslist.name: Calibrachoa Noa

flowerslist.info: Choose the brightest windows in your house for your orchids, place on an humidity tray and spray regularly.
flowerslist.name: Phalaenopsis Purple

flowerslist.info: They thrive in fertile, fast draining, slightly alkaline (pH 6.75) soil. Avoid overwatering.
flowerslist.name: Dianthus

flowerslist.info: Chrysanthemums respond to plenty of food and moisture, and prefer full sun.
flowerslist.name: Chrysanthemum

flowerslist.info: Summer flowering, 12–18” high, likes full sun and well drained soil. Drought tolerant.
flowerslist.name: Armeria Alliacea

flowerslist.info: Add water until there is half inch of dry soil on the surface. Do not water again until the soil is completely dry.
flowerslist.name: Red Cactus

flowerslist.info: Drought tolerant, well drained soil. Prefers full sun.
flowerslist.name: Aloe Vera

flowerslist.info: Easy to care for, requiring watering only when they’re dry. They like bright but indirect light.
flowerslist.name: Schlumbergera

flowerslist.info: Locate it in a place where it is exposed to at least a few hours of direct sunlight.
flowerslist.name: Senecio Rowleyanus

flowerslist.info: Growing as a large roughly spherical globe, it may eventually reach over a meter in height after many years.
flowerslist.name: Echinocactus Grusonii

flowerslist.info: The plants should be kept almost completely dry during the winter months, once a month should be fine.
flowerslist.name: Opuntia Falcata
